00002 
00003   Name:         cc7700pci.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt, adapted from camdrv.c by E. Sanshiro

00006   Contents:     Device driver for TOYO CC/7700 PCI CAMAC controller
00007                 following the MIDAS CAMAC Standard under DIRECTIO

00029 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00030 
00031 #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
00032 #include <dos.h>
00033 #define OUTP(_p, _d) outportb(_p, _d)
00034 #define OUTPW(_p, _d) outport(_p, _d)
00035 #define INP(_p) inportb(_p)
00036 #define INPW(_p) inport(_p)
00037 #define OUTP_P(_p, _d) outportb(_p, _d)
00038 #define OUTPW_P(_p, _d) outport(_p, _d)
00039 #define INP_P(_p) inportb(_p)
00040 #define INPW_P(_p) inport(_p)
00041 #elif defined( _MSC_VER )
00042 #include <windows.h>
00043 #include <conio.h>
00044 #define OUTP(_p, _d) _outp((unsigned short) (_p), (int) (_d))
00045 #define OUTPW(_p, _d) _outpw((unsigned short) (_p), (unsigned short) (_d))
00046 #define OUTPL(_p, _d) _outpd((unsigned short) (_p), (unsigned long) (_d))
00047 #define INP(_p) _inp((unsigned short) (_p))
00048 #define INPW(_p) _inpw((unsigned short) (_p))
00049 #define INPL(_p) _inpd((unsigned short) (_p))
00050 #define OUTP_P(_p, _d) {_outp((unsigned short) (_p), (int) (_d)); _outp((unsigned short)0x80,0);}
00051 #define OUTPW_P(_p, _d) {_outpw((unsigned short) (_p), (unsigned short) (_d)); _outp((unsigned short)0x80,0);}
00052 #define INP_P(_p) _inp((unsigned short) (_p)); _outp((unsigned short)0x80,0);
00053 #define INPW_P(_p) _inpw((unsigned short) (_p));_outp((unsigned short)0x80,0);
00054 #elif defined( OS_LINUX )
00055 #if !defined(__OPTIMIZE__)
00056 #error Please compile cc7700.c with the -O flag to make port access possible
00057 #endif
00058 #include <asm/io.h>
00059 //#include <unistd.h>
00060 #define OUTP(_p, _d) outb(_d, _p)
00061 #define OUTPW(_p, _d) outw(_d, _p)
00062 #define OUTPL(_p, _d) outl(_d, _p)
00063 #define INP(_p) inb(_p)
00064 #define INPW(_p) inw(_p)
00065 #define INPL(_p) inl(_p)
00066 #define OUTP_P(_p, _d) outb_p(_d, _p)
00067 #define OUTPW_P(_p, _d) outw_p(_d, _p)
00068 #define INP_P(_p) inb_p(_p)
00069 #define INPW_P(_p) inw_p(_p)
00070 #endif
00071 
00072 #if defined( _MSC_VER )
00073 #define INLINE __inline
00074 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
00075 #define INLINE __inline__
00076 #else
00077 #define INLINE
00078 #endif

00080 /*- Global var -----------------------------------------------------*/
00081 
00082 static unsigned int iobase;
00083 
00084 /* Register mapping */
00085 
00086 enum cc7700_regs {
00087    regCONTROL = 0x00,
00088    regSTATUS = 0x00,
00089    regCOMMAND = 0x04,
00090    regLAM = 0x04,
00091    regDATA = 0x08,
00092    regGO = 0x0C
00093 };
00094 
00095 enum cc7700_ctrlbits {
00096    ctrlCLEAR = 0x01,
00097    ctrlINITIALIZE = 0x02,
00098    ctrlINHIBIT = 0x04,
00099    ctrlENABLEINTERRUPT = 0x08,
00100    ctrlRESET = 0x40,
00101    ctrlLAMINTERNAL = 0x80
00102 };
00103 
00104 enum cc7700_statbits {
00105    statNOQ = 0x01,
00106    statNOX = 0x02,
00107    statINHIBIT = 0x04,
00108    statENABLEINTERRUPT = 0x08,
00109    statDONE = 0x10,
00110    statONLINE = 0x20,
00111    statLAMSUM = 0x40,
00112    statLAMINTERNAL = 0x80
00113 };
00114 
00115 #define CONTROL_KEPT_BIT_MASK (0x04 | 0x08 | 0x80)
00116 #define STATUS_BIT_MASK 0x00ff
00117 
00118 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00119 
00120 int wait_done()
00121 {
00122    int i, status;
00123 
00124    for (i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
00125       status = INP(iobase + regSTATUS);
00126       if (status & statDONE)
00127          break;
00128    }
00129 
00130    return status;
00131 }
00132 
00133 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00134 
00135 INLINE void cam8i(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, unsigned char *d)
00136 {
00137    OUTPL(iobase + regCOMMAND, ((c & 0x7) << 16) |
00138          (((n - 1) & 0x1F) << 9) | ((a & 0xF) << 5) | (f & 0x1F));
00139 
00140    OUTPW(iobase + regGO, 0);
00141    wait_done();
00142 
00143    *((unsigned char *) d) = INP(iobase + regDATA);
00144 }
00145 
00146 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00147 
00148 INLINE void cami(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, unsigned short *d)
00149 {
00150    OUTPL(iobase + regCOMMAND, ((c & 0x7) << 16) |
00151          (((n - 1) & 0x1F) << 9) | ((a & 0xF) << 5) | (f & 0x1F));
00152 
00153    OUTPW(iobase + regGO, 0);
00154    wait_done();
00155 
00156    *d = INPW(iobase + regDATA);
00157 }
00158 
00159 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00160 
00161 INLINE void cam16i(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, unsigned short *d)
00162 {
00163    cami(c, n, a, f, d);
00164 }
00165 
00166 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00167 
00168 INLINE void cam24i(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, DWORD * d)
00169 {
00170    OUTPL(iobase + regCOMMAND, ((c & 0x7) << 16) |
00171          (((n - 1) & 0x1F) << 9) | ((a & 0xF) << 5) | (f & 0x1F));
00172 
00173    OUTPW(iobase + regGO, 0);
00174    wait_done();
00175 
00176    *d = INPL(iobase + regDATA) & 0xFFFFFF;
00177 }
00178 
00179 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00180 
00181 INLINE void cam8i_q(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00182                     unsigned char *d, int *x, int *q)
00183 {
00184    WORD status;
00185 
00186    OUTPL(iobase + regCOMMAND, ((c & 0x7) << 16) |
00187          (((n - 1) & 0x1F) << 9) | ((a & 0xF) << 5) | (f & 0x1F));
00188 
00189    OUTPW(iobase + regGO, 0);
00190    status = wait_done();
00191 
00192    *((unsigned char *) d) = INP(iobase + regDATA);
00193 
00194    *q = ((status & 1) == 0);
00195    *x = ((status & 2) == 0);
00196 }
00197 
00198 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00199 
00200 INLINE void cam16i_q(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00201                      unsigned short *d, int *x, int *q)
00202 {
00203    WORD status;
00204 
00205    OUTPL(iobase + regCOMMAND, ((c & 0x7) << 16) |
00206          (((n - 1) & 0x1F) << 9) | ((a & 0xF) << 5) | (f & 0x1F));
00207 
00208    OUTPW(iobase + regGO, 0);
00209    status = wait_done();
00210 
00211    *d = INPW(iobase + regDATA);
00212 
00213    *q = ((status & 1) == 0);
00214    *x = ((status & 2) == 0);
00215 }
00216 
00217 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/

00219                      DWORD * d, int *x, int *q)

00225 
00226    OUTPW(iobase + regGO, 0);
00227    status = wait_done();
00228 
00229    *d = INPL(iobase + regDATA) & 0xFFFFFF;
00230 
00231    *q = ((status & 1) == 0);
00232    *x = ((status & 2) == 0);
00233 }

00257 
00258 INLINE void cam16i_rq(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00259                       unsigned short **d, const int r)
00260 {
00261    unsigned short i;
00262    int q, x;
00263 
00264    for (i = 0; i < r; i++) {
00265       cam16i_q(c, n, a, f, (*d)++, &x, &q);
00266       if (!q)
00267          break;
00268    }
00269 }

00280       cam24i_q(c, n, a, f, (*d)++, &x, &q);
00281       if (!q)
00282          break;

00332 INLINE void cam8o(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, unsigned char d)
00333 {
00334    OUTPL(iobase + regCOMMAND, ((c & 0x7) << 16) |
00335          (((n - 1) & 0x1F) << 9) | ((a & 0xF) << 5) | (f & 0x1F));
00336 
00337    OUTP(iobase + regDATA, d);
00338    OUTPW(iobase + regGO, 0);
00339 
00340    wait_done();
00341 }
00342

00345 INLINE void camo(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, unsigned short d)
00346 {
00347    OUTPL(iobase + regCOMMAND, ((c & 0x7) << 16) |
00348          (((n - 1) & 0x1F) << 9) | ((a & 0xF) << 5) | (f & 0x1F));
00349 
00350    OUTPW(iobase + regDATA, d);
00351    OUTPW(iobase + regGO, 0);
00352 
00353    wait_done();
00354 }

00378 INLINE void cam16o_q(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00379                      unsigned short d, int *x, int *q)
00380 {
00381    int status;
00382 
00383    OUTPL(iobase + regCOMMAND, ((c & 0x7) << 16) |
00384          (((n - 1) & 0x1F) << 9) | ((a & 0xF) << 5) | (f & 0x1F));
00385 
00386    OUTPL(iobase + regDATA, d);
00387    OUTPW(iobase + regGO, 0);
00388 
00389    status = wait_done();
00390 
00391    *q = ((status & 1) == 0);
00392    *x = ((status & 2) == 0);
00393 }

00447 
00448 INLINE int camc_chk(const int c)
00449 {
00450    unsigned int status;
00451 
00452    /* check status, don't know how to check controller */
00453    status = INP(iobase + regSTATUS);
00454    if ((status & 0xF0) != 0x30)
00455       return -1;
00456 
00457    return 0;
00458 }

00462 INLINE void camc(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f)
00463 {
00464    OUTPL(iobase + regCOMMAND, ((c & 0x7) << 16) |
00465          (((n - 1) & 0x1F) << 9) | ((a & 0xF) << 5) | (f & 0x1F));
00466    OUTPL(iobase + regGO, 0);
00467    wait_done();
00468 }
00469

00471 
00472 INLINE void camc_q(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, int *q)
00473 {
00474    unsigned status;
00475 
00476    OUTPL(iobase + regCOMMAND, ((c & 0x7) << 16) |
00477          (((n - 1) & 0x1F) << 9) | ((a & 0xF) << 5) | (f & 0x1F));
00478    OUTPL(iobase + regGO, 0);
00479    status = wait_done();
00480 
00481    *q = ((status & 1) == 0);
00482 }

00504 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00505 
00506 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00507 static HANDLE _hdio = 0;
00508 #endif
00509 
00510 INLINE int cam_init(void)
00511 {
00512 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00513    OSVERSIONINFO vi;
00514    DWORD buffer[] = { 8, 0x0001, 0xcc77, 0 };
00515    DWORD retbuf[7];
00516    int size;
00517 
00518    vi.dwOSVersionInfoSize = sizeof(OSVERSIONINFO);
00519    GetVersionEx(&vi);
00520 
00521    /* use DirectIO driver under NT to gain port access */
00522    if (vi.dwPlatformId == VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT) {
00523       _hdio = CreateFile("\\\\.\\directio", GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, NULL,
00524                          OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
00525       if (_hdio == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
00526          printf("cc7700pci.c: Cannot access IO ports (No DirectIO driver installed)\n");
00527          return -1;
00528       }
00529    }
00530 
00531    /* get IO base from ProbePCI function in DirectIO driver */
00532    if (!DeviceIoControl(_hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer),
00533                         retbuf, sizeof(retbuf), &size, NULL))
00534       return -1;
00535 
00536    /* stip last four bits */
00537    iobase = (retbuf[1] & 0xFFF0);
00538 
00539    /* open ports for direct access */
00540    buffer[0] = 6;
00541    buffer[1] = iobase;
00542    buffer[2] = iobase + 0x10;
00543 
00544    if (!DeviceIoControl(_hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, buffer, sizeof(buffer),
00545                         NULL, 0, &size, NULL))
00546       return -1;
00547 
00548 #endif                          /* _MSC_VER */
00549 #ifdef OS_LINUX
00550 
00551    /* 
00552       In order to access the IO ports of the CAMAC interface, one needs
00553       to call the ioperm() function for those ports. This requires root
00554       privileges. For normal operation, this is performed by the "dio"
00555       program, which is a "setuid" program having temporarily root privi-
00556       lege. So the frontend is started with "dio frontend". Since the
00557       frontend cannot be debugged through the dio program, we suplly here
00558       the direct ioperm call which requires the program to be run as root,
00559       making it possible to debug it. The program has then to be compiled
00560       with "gcc -DDO_IOPERM -o frontend frontend.c hyt1331.c ..."
00561     */
00562 
00563 #ifdef DO_IOPERM
00564    if (iobase < 0x3FF) {
00565       ioperm(0x80, 1, 1);
00566       if (ioperm(iobase, 0x10, 1) < 0) {
00567          printf("cc7700pci.c: Cannot call ioperm() (no root privileges)\n");
00568          return -1;
00569       }
00570    } else {
00571       if (iopl(3) < 0) {
00572          printf("cc7700pci.c: Cannot call iopl() (no root privileges)\n");
00573          return -1;
00574       }
00575    }
00576 #endif
00577 
00578 #endif
00579 
00580    /* reset controller */
00581    OUTPW(iobase + regCONTROL, ctrlRESET);
00582 
00583    return SUCCESS;
00584 }
00585 
00586 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00587 
00588 INLINE void cam_exit(void)
00589 {
00590 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00591    DWORD buffer[] = { 6, iobase, iobase + 0x10, 0 };
00592    DWORD size;
00593 
00594    if (_hdio <= 0)
00595       return;
00596 
00597    DeviceIoControl(_hdio, (unsigned short) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer),
00598                    NULL, 0, &size, NULL);
00599 #endif
00600 #ifdef OS_LINUX
00601 #ifdef DO_IOPERM
00602    if (iobase < 0x3FF) {
00603       ioperm(0x80, 1, 0);
00604       ioperm(iobase, 0x10, 0);
00605    } else
00606       iopl(0);
00607 #endif
00608 #endif
00609 }
00610 
00611 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00612 
00613 INLINE void cam_inhibit_set(const int c)
00614 {
00615    unsigned int reg;
00616 
00617    reg = INPW(iobase + regCONTROL) & CONTROL_KEPT_BIT_MASK;
00618    reg |= ctrlINHIBIT;
00619    OUTPL(iobase + regCONTROL, reg | (c << 16));
00620 }
00621 
00622 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00623 
00624 INLINE void cam_inhibit_clear(const int c)
00625 {
00626    unsigned int reg;
00627 
00628    reg = INPW(iobase + regCONTROL) & CONTROL_KEPT_BIT_MASK;
00629    reg &= ~ctrlINHIBIT;
00630    OUTPL(iobase + regCONTROL, reg | (c << 16));
00631 }
00632 
00633 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00634 
00635 INLINE void cam_crate_clear(const int c)
00636 {
00637    unsigned int reg;
00638 
00639    reg = INPW(iobase + regCONTROL) & CONTROL_KEPT_BIT_MASK;
00640    reg |= ctrlCLEAR;
00641    OUTPL(iobase + regCONTROL, reg | (c << 16));
00642 }
00643 
00644 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00645 
00646 INLINE void cam_crate_zinit(const int c)
00647 {
00648    unsigned int reg;
00649 
00650    reg = INPW(iobase + regCONTROL) & CONTROL_KEPT_BIT_MASK;
00651    reg &= ctrlINITIALIZE;
00652    OUTPL(iobase + regCONTROL, reg | (c << 16));
00653 }
00654 
00655 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00656 
00657 INLINE void cam_lam_enable(const int c, const int n)
00658 {
00659    unsigned int reg;
00660 
00661    /* enable interrupts in controller */
00662    reg = INPW(iobase + regCONTROL) & CONTROL_KEPT_BIT_MASK;
00663    reg |= ctrlENABLEINTERRUPT;
00664    OUTPL(iobase + regCONTROL, reg | (c << 16));
00665 }
00666 
00667 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00668 
00669 INLINE void cam_lam_disable(const int c, const int n)
00670 {
00671    unsigned int reg;
00672 
00673    /* disenable interrupts in controller */
00674    reg = INPW(iobase + regCONTROL) & CONTROL_KEPT_BIT_MASK;
00675    reg &= ~ctrlENABLEINTERRUPT;
00676    OUTPL(iobase + regCONTROL, reg | (c << 16));
00677 }
00678 
00679 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00680 
00681 INLINE void cam_lam_read(const int c, DWORD * lam)
00682 {
00683    *lam = INPL(iobase + regLAM) & 0xFFFFFF;
00684 }
00685 
00686 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00687 
00688 INLINE void cam_lam_clear(const int c, const int n)
00689 {
00690    /* signal End-Of-Interrupt */
00691 #ifdef __MSDOS__
00692    OUTP(0x20, 0x20);
00693 #endif
00694 
00695    /* clear LAM flip-flop in unit */
00696    camc(c, n, 0, 10);
00697 }
00698 
00699 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00700 
00701 INLINE void cam_interrupt_enable(const int c)
00702 {
00703 #ifdef __MSDOS__
00704    unsigned char mask;
00705 
00706    mask = INP(0x21);
00707    mask &= (~(1 << LAM_IRQ));
00708    OUTP(0x21, mask);
00709 #endif
00710 }
00711 
00712 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00713 
00714 INLINE void cam_interrupt_disable(const int c)
00715 {
00716 #ifdef __MSDOS__
00717    unsigned char mask;
00718 
00719    mask = INP(0x21);
00720    mask |= 1 << LAM_IRQ;
00721    OUTP(0x21, mask);
00722 #endif
00723 }
00724 
00725 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00726 
00727 static void (*old_handler) (void) = (void *) 0;
00728 
00729 INLINE void cam_interrupt_attach(const int c, const int n, void (*isr) (void))
00730 {
00731 #ifdef __MSDOS__
00732    old_handler = (void (*)()) getvect(LAM_INT);
00733    setvect(LAM_INT, (void interrupt(*)()) isr);
00734 #endif
00735 }
00736 
00737 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00738 
00739 INLINE void cam_interrupt_detach(const int c, const int n)
00740 {
00741 #ifdef __MSDOS__
00742    if (old_handler)
00743       setvect(LAM_INT, (void interrupt(*)()) old_handler);
00744 #endif
00745 }
00746 
00747 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00748 
00749 INLINE int cam_init_rpc(char *host_name, char *exp_name, char *fe_name, char *client_name,
00750                         char *rpc_server)
00751 {
00752    return 1;
00753 }
